meanings.sent1: Her artwork lacked conceptuality, as it was simply a collection of random shapes and colors.
meanings.sent2: In philosophy class, we discussed the conceptuality of abstract ideas.
meanings.sent3: The conceptuality of the math problem made it seem like a fun puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: The conceptuality of time as a fluid concept fascinated the young student.
meanings.sent5: The conceptuality of emotions can be complex and difficult to understand.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of existing as a concept.
meanings.sent1: The conceptuality of democracy is based on the idea of equality for all.
meanings.sent2: The conceptuality of freedom is cherished by many around the world.
meanings.sent3: The conceptuality of a unicorn living in the backyard amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The conceptuality of love as a universal language transcends all barriers.
meanings.sent5: The conceptuality of justice is often depicted as a blindfolded woman holding scales.
